description: ND Allocator is an independent governance channel within the Filecoin Plus (Fil+) program operated by ND Labs. It focuses on onboarding Cyberport and enterprise datasets into Filecoin through structured workflows, KYB verification, and transparent allocation mechanisms. ND Allocator contributes to improving the quality and auditability of verified data, bridging enterprise data sources with the decentralized storage economy.
additional_impact:
Helped prototype community co-review mechanisms, where multiple verifiers can participate in the same review process.


Serves as a reference governance model for integrating enterprise clients with decentralized infrastructure.


Demonstrated how regional SPs and allocators can contribute meaningfully to the global Fil+ program.
end_user:
Enterprise data clients — gain structured onboarding and verification support for uploading datasets to Filecoin.


Fil+ Allocators and reviewers — benefit from improved review templates, consistent governance practices, and KYB workflows.


Filecoin governance community — gains more auditable, transparent, and reproducible allocator operations.
testimonials:
ND Allocator has received 10+ positive reviews from Fil+ governance members, enterprise clients, and ecosystem reviewers.
Governance contributors commended ND Allocator’s structured due diligence and audit transparency.


Enterprise users praised the clear submission process and data traceability.
governance_accessibility_impact:
ND Allocator makes Fil+ governance participation more accessible and auditable by providing open documentation, templates, and processes:
Published public guides detailing allocator decision workflows and review standards.


Simplified form-based submission to allow more allocators to replicate standardized procedures.


Actively participated in governance discussions, advocating for transparent reporting and KYB-first verification.


Created open dashboards and documentation that lower the learning curve for new allocators.
